reviewText:
The first time I played this game:
-My PC didn't have a dedicated GPU and I ran Half-Life in software mode
-PC's processor speed was < 500 MHz, had maybe 128 MB RAM
-My internet connection was dial-up
-Counter-Strike was still at version beta 6 or 6.5
-I was in grade school

Compared to now:
-Well-built PC for gaming
-Broadband internet connection
-CS:GO is a competitive game played world-wide at a professional level
-I'm an adult who's gotta pay bills, taxes, and go to work

Lots of things have changed, but as far as this game is concerned, the most important thing hasn't changed: This game is still fun! Download it and enjoy!

You've got co-op teammates to be smacking around with a crowbar for no apparent reason (or maybe as a signal that they need to move), so get to it!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mBmHT1IB1bs

reviewText:
Back in the days when I was a young stud with peaking testosterone levels and firm glutes, me and my friends were rocking this mod after high school. Please note that this was in an era where communication using smartphones was yet to be invented. Sven Co-op for us was what social media is now for the kids. Yes, although hard to imagine for youngsters nowadays, back then we also played outside at times, but when we had to be home in order to accomplish homework tasks, our only escape from this by society accepted torment was to play online multiplayer games with each other - most of them being first person shooters.

Now, a decade later, Sven Co-op finally made it to Steam. But where are those friends now? Some of them have been lost in time, few I still play games with. But never Sven Co-op. Not Sven Co-op. Am I the only one stuck in time, thriving on nostalgia? I recently played again, after all those years. It's still great, but it's not the same anymore.

Sven Co-op was part of a man's teen life. When you're reading this and playing Sven Co-op within one, perhaps several decades, remember that this is my legacy. Remember the sentiment this game has brought to a grown-up man yearning for his youth.

reviewText:
Correct me if I am wrong, but the ADHD children of this age are not the target audience of this game. Based on the negative reviews shown to me, these are the kinds of people making a lot of the bad reviews. They seem hastily written by semi-illiterates used to the numerous, and very often poorly made, free games on Steam.

You can't really blame them for their opinions, though. It's a bit like how children who are used to eating only tasty fast food will prefer fast food over a nutritious, healthy meal. The problem is that they will always prefer this. They're used to a yearly CoD release with pretty graphics and mindless shooting, not puzzles, exploration and cooperation. This is why a game like Sven Co-op will never get the recognition that it deserves; poorly made but easier alternatives. Teaching yourself to digest something real requires motivation, of which said people have none, since there is a steady supply of junk always ready on their plates.

I'd call this a blessing in disguise, however. By not compromising with modern audiences, the developers have managed to stay true to the spirit of a now 17 year old game. They haven't sold out their game, and I am personally grateful for that. You see, this keeps away the stupid - the average 2016 consumer of video games - which keeps the game in its normal state, since nothing has to be dumbed down for a quick buck. For instance, I love that on every server I've played on, people are still capable of assisting each other. Firefights, puzzles and healing each other all comes naturally. This is not possible on an average server in a game like Team Fortress 2, and feels very unique to Sven Coop.

It's too bad that today, it seems you either have to make a great game that a few people might really like, or a horrible, generic piece of fast food that everyone will want to consume. It's truly fantastic to see the game finally reach Steam though. A group of people idealistic and interested enough to stick by a Half-Life 1 mod for 17 years is something very special. Someone like that is capable of great things, Sven-Coop being a prime example. They deserve a great deal of thanks for this mod. I am so glad to be playing it again after all these years.

I recommend this game to any patient lover of the fluid gameplay that the Half-Life 1 engine provides. The amazing and original map design also deserves mention. You will know how much of an understatement this when you play the game. Map series like ‚Äòsc_tetris‚Äô, ‚ÄòThey‚Äô and good old ‚ÄòToonrun‚Äô spring to mind. I highly recommend that you try these, if you decide to test out the game.

Have fun!

reviewText: The many hours spend in the early 2000s playing all the custom maps/mods and mini campaigns might not be shown here but this is a brilliant return of one the best Half-Life mods ever. And it's F2P! No microtransactions, no DLC, no crashes (well 99% of the time!), no hussle to set up a server, no framerate issues, just pure action and fun with friends for hours. If you haven't had the opportunity to play this back in the day for whatever reason, it's never too late.\n\nHopefully a workshop implementation in the future for more custom community maps is the only thing missing from this release, but it's sure is nice to have this gem back.

reviewText:
Through this game I met my friends, and shared hours and hours of fun. You can be a soldier in the middle of the desert, bombing critical locations, or a civilian trying to survive a zombie onslaught (with permadeath!). Or, even a wacky toon world, filled with clowny monsters. Maybe you like surreal maps? There's a couple, too. Wanna play Afraid Of Monsters with friends, so you don't get scared? Say no more. It's one of the most versatile mods I've seen. Maps have some of the most heavy customization you can expect from, well, an engine from 1998 (well, it has some several tweaks, but still).

Graphics look amazing. Enemies look better than ever, with HD models and improved animations. Guns look impressive too, and don't get me started on the textures. Sounds have been improved over the years (never forget 4.0's popcorn MP5) and you can change them pretty easily too.

Community is still active (After 10 minutes from the release I stumbled upon a server with 32 slots - and it was full) pumping new content fairly often.

And all of this?
For free.

Go on, download it. I did it when I was 13. Today, at 20 years old, I can't say that I regret it.

reviewText: This is by far the easiest way to play Half Life 1 multiplayer on the PC, and best of all, it is completely free!  The release of Sven Co-op as a standalone title on Steam has skyrocketed the population of the multiplayer community, so there has never been a better time to play!  The game also features a sizable amount of custom maps and skins, allowing for a replayable and customizable experience.\n\nIf you love FPS/puzzle games and can forgive some dated graphics, there is no excuse not to have this in your library.  If you enjoy this game but want a semi-prettier experience, Synergy is a similarly designed mod for Half Life 2 but you will need to own HL2 on Steam to play.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Includes whole Half-Life campaign for free (Thanks Valve!)
- Crap ton of playermodels so you can be a mushroom & stuff
- Massive support for community-made content (Game is full of custom maps & theres even a whole website dedicated to making them)
- Most of the older bugs have been fixed
- Still uses VAC despite being mainly a co-op game
- Free

Cons:
- They changed the original viewmodels (If somebody makes a modpack I'll be fine)
- A few maps of the Half-Life campaign were changed drastically (only a few, so it's ok I guess...)
- Buggy as hell
- You collide with players
- You can set off a nuke in one of the HL1 campaign maps (So the map keeps restarting...)
- Only supports windows at the moment
- Servers with over 8 people will most likely break the game depending on the map
- Cutscenes screw up voice chat and make everybody sound like robots
- Voice chat quality is not very good compared to current games
- Free

Overall:
Epic, very buggy and theres heaps of things that need to be changed but still a very good mod.
Hope they port it to mac/linux soon too!

reviewText:
I'm mainly a console game and I'm relatively new to Steam. I adore the Half-Life saga, have no money on my account, and have a cruddy laptop, so me and Sven Co-Op are a match made in heaven; it's Half-Life, it's free, and my computer can handle the horribly outdated graphics! (Don't get me wrong, the game does look really nice for something that came at the turn of the century) Before I saw on GameInformer.com that Sven Co-Op was being released on Steam for free, I had no idea the mod existed, and I didn't have a clue what I was doing going in. I was expecting Sven Co-Op to be nothing more than a free pass to play the original Half-Life, so I was initially disappointed when I joined a random server only to find myself fighting zombies whilst trying my best to learn the controls. However, after I spent several hours mastering the controls and weapons, I was hooked. Slaying endless waves of enemies, role-playing with fantasy textures, and completing Mario-themed parkour courses is just as fun as the main game, but when you finally do find a campaign server, the fun reaches its height. I don't think I'll ever forget completing the last stretch of the game with 30 other people. The lag was insane, but it was worth it simply for the laughs I got from the sight of all of us crammed into a gondola while the G-Man gave his speech. If you're lucky, you might also come across a PvP server. I've only played a few, but they were all awesome -- especially this server called ModRiot that had CTF with classes!

It's also worth noting that Sven features some awesome weapons and NPCs not found in HL1 or its expansions. New weapons include the Uzi, which can be dual weilded, and the MP5A3, a scoped assault rifle. Some of the new NPCs are the minigun-weilding Human Sergeant and Zombie Barney. Some of the weapons from Half-Life and Opposing Force have been tweaked as well -- the SPAS-12 shotgun's secondary is full auto instead of a double-barrel shot; the .357 Magnum has a scope; the MP5 fires in 3-round bursts (ala Halo's Battle Rifle) instead of full auto and has to reload grenades; and the RPG's laser guide can be toggled on and off

All of this stuff is great, but the best part about Sven is that unlike GMod, this game's HL2 equivalent, the fanbase isn't composed of mainly squeaky voiced teens that spout out racial slurs - I only encountered one, and everyone else I played with was nice.

The only issue I have with Sven now that I'm experienced is that I was unable to add any servers to my favorites list. Every time I go to the list, none of the servers show up. If there is a way to fix this, please comment below, becuase having searching my history for fun servers is aggravating.

I recommend Sven Co-Op to any fan of Half-Life, and if you played this mod when it was in its youth, than you have no reason not to take an admission-free trip down memory lane. If you're a n00b like I was, than the game will take some getting used to, but you'll have a blast once you're prepared.

PROS
Half the Life for none of the price!
Awesome user-made maps
Weapons and NPCs not in vanilla HL1
Great fanbase CONS
Not friendly to newbies
Favorites list doesn't work VERDICT : 8.5 out of 10, would play again

First Black Mesa, than this, and now Prospekt ... Half-Life 3 confirmed?

reviewText:
Here's the deal: if you have a group of friends that you can play with, this game is perfect. If you happen to come across a decently sized group of random people that are more or less nice and actually try to have an intelligent gaming session, this game can be very enjoyable. However, at the moment, joining random servers usually results in a huge unplayable mess with 20+ people running around aimlessly, breaking scripts, blocking characters, getting stuck in doors and on the elevators and screaming into their mics. I've played for 3.2 hours, and 90% of the time the experience was extremely random and sometimes... questionable.

This is as raw as it gets: you will get insulted, kicked for no reason, you will be stuck on one level just because someone decided to block the passage, in a group of 30 people your actual skills mean nothing, and the majority of your kills will be thanks to chance, not to your accuracy or speed. Pretty much everyone playing knows the Half-Life levels inside out, so 50% of players always try to speedrun the maps, which can be somewhat annoying. But I guess this is how it's always been, so nothing new, really.

But then you might end up in a game with players who actually TRY to get some enjoyment out of the deal, and the experience changes drastically! Suddenly, you're actually working as a team, backing each other up, and trying to progress at a normal pace, having a nice playful chat and even roleplaying sometimes. It is a real pity that this doesn't happen often.

As you can see, though, I AM recommending Sven Coop, because when it functions as intended, it truly shines. From a technical standpoint, it's a very nice piece of work, the amount of content here is huge - custom maps, models, game types, sounds, improved graphics and overall optimization, AND you get Half-Life for free. But if you are like me, and you prefer your game to have at least SOME sort of sense and purpose, and you actually want to have a really good time, go gather your friends, make a server, lock it up, and play like that. Or, create a topic, find people willing to play along, filter out everyone else, and then play with them. Otherwise, you're gonna end up in a rollercoster or randomness, and your satisfaction, or even good mood, is NOT guaranteed.
voteText: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This used to be a mod before it was an actual game, now it comes out. Everyone including myself were waiting for this moment. I've been playing Sven Co-op since 4.8 and i still have it. I wont be needing it anymore now that the newest version is the game itself, 5.0.

Now that is on Steam i'm giving out the statistics. It is a great GAME, a game that continues its way just like the mod did except adding more stuff in it thats not in 4.8. The game is heavily focused on teamwork against bot controlled enemies. Whether its aliens, marines, nazis, you name it. You play as any character based from either Half-Life or any other games (Such as the Doomguy in Doom, Young Link from Zelda, Mario from Mario games, etc.).

The maps are heavily on campaign, so your objective is to reach through it whether by fighting enemies, solve puzzles, or both. Theres a HUGE amount of maps you can play on. If you are suddenly on the loading screen, it means someone has reached the end of the map which causes a new map to load up. Also keep noted the guns you see, sometimes you get different guns depends on the campaign you play (such as the thompson if played in WWII maps).

There is Half life maps, but there are also modded maps. If you are feeling for adventure, you came in the right place.

Give yourself time to try the game when you can and while you still can. Note that low players does not always mean a bad thing, being yourself is whats worst since it'll make the game harder playing by yourself. Having just one person with you is enough, bringing more will bring on the carnage. The game may be too easy for you if you bring on the best team or just simply bring LOTS of people with you. You want a fair fun game where you are fighting through with others as a team.

The bosses also are VERY promising in most maps. Some maps has bosses, some dont. But you will see one at some point depending on the map you are playing on.

I truly recommend this to anyone, its going to be a blast when playing this.

reviewText:
Aside from the odd server which has unexperienced players in it, Sven Co-op is a thrilling, intense and highly cutomizable mod for the original Half Life game, all bundled together into a free to play standalone. With no freemium purchases or microtransactions, you get the whole package in this bundle.

Mods are built into Sven Co-op to allow Roleplays, Labyrinths, Quests and much, much more on multiple servers. With Sven Co-op having a proactive community and the ability to make a standard Half-Life Vanilla server yourself, one can not get bored. I would recommend inviting all of your friends who love the Half Life series over to Sven and playing on your own server with them, nothing as hectic as 'partially' co-ordinated strikes against zombies, whilst only having crowbars. The interesting bit behind Sven Co-op however is the customization, with you able to change the colour of your 'avatar', which ranges from the models Sven Co-op has, the female versions of Gordon, Gordon himself, Barney, alternative skins, a Jill Valentine 'Half Life' style skin, Robots, Marines [Including Shephard from Opposing Force] and even Ivan the Space Biker! [The original Gordon].
With Sven Co-op allowing you to download extras, such as the campaigns for Blue Shift and Opposing Force respectively, you will not feel a sense of repetition in the campaign and when you're all done, you can go back to the Mod-built servers.

Overall Sven Co-op I recommend for anybody who wants a pure free-to-play game, wants to reminisce the old days of gaming or has wanted Half Life [1] to be Co-op. There is something in Sven to please everyone, ignore the negatives that people say, it is as easy to leave a server or mute the players and proceed on. The positives are only found by actually searching, I was unlucky as I automatically connected to a Russian Mod/RP Server, where everyone was screaming Russian over the microphone. I simply disconnected and joined a Vanilla server manually, from there on, it was easy going.

On a rating of 1 to 10, I would give Sven Co-op a 9.5/10, as it is the best it can be, the only downsides are.. You guessed it! The lack of 'Instructions' when you start up the game and the small amount of 'bugs' that are present, but are generally NOT gamebraking: I do not play this on a 'Gaming Rig', I play this on my Laptop and this game runs very smoothly for a ¬£200 Laptop. With the developers quite pro-active themselves, the bugs are not around for quite long before they get patched.

Sven Co-op in my eyes, is one of the best mods on the Half Life series and does not require anything at all, not even the base game to play. I would recommend this to anyone who asks me about Sven Co-op.

reviewText:
This is one of the best first person shooter games I've ever played, plain and simple.

Sven Co-op is a fun and addictive goldsrc game packing a lot of fun, it begins during the Black Mesa incident, that of course if you decide to play the Half Life campaign. There are plenty of maps to play on other than the Half Life story.

Sven Co-op is at this point one of the oldest received and best games and I'm sure pretty much everyone has played it. If not, well what the hell are you doing reading this review? You need install this game straight away and play it right now.

The game is a simple first person shooter, but it does plenty things different than the regular first person shooters. You have a health bar and you have to do platforming to solve some of the puzzles. Not to mention the the graphic engine is rather old, it's still doing quite well.

For a game that came out back in 1999 it still looks amazing. Now while it does have so low res textures it still looks decent and I experienced zero problems while playing the game. This game runs really well and should run on pretty much all systems.

The game for the most part is pretty easy. I played through the game without a problem, even though some segments were tough due to the fast movement you have to pull off to avoid gunfire. Not to mention the Xen battles are incredibly intense and quite difficult.

Apart from the Sven Co-op maps, the Half Life campaign doesn't provide any replayability. There is enough user created content to keep you interested and the game is updated frequently

In the end Sven Co-op is a fantastic game. It's a must play for everyone who is a gamer. This game is a piece of history and without a doubt one of the best games I have ever played in my entire life.

9.5/10 - A must play

reviewText:
Sven Co-op...Where does one even start...Well lets explain exactly what it is.

Sven Co-op is an engine overhaul for the original GoldSrc engine used for Half-Life 1 that allows users to play any of the Half-Life 1 anthology stories or user created mods or levels with as many people as they want. You ever dreamed about running through the halls of Sector C with 12 other HEVsuits and gmen? You can do it here. You ever wanted to explore the tunnels in Foxtrot Uniform with other Soldiers armed with M60s? Yup! You want to play the horror mods of They Hunger and Afraid of Monsters with friends? Sven Co-op has you covered, you get the idea.

One of the oldest Half-Life 1 mods in exsistance, Sven Co-op has been in development since 1999 and with this steam release comes it's 5.0 version which has added extra functionallity for map creators to toy around with, such as inventory systems to improve map flexibillity and creative oppurtunity. The Mod itself already has so much content to experience, it tweaks weapons, improves animations, custom models, adds some new toys, comes with it's own library of maps for you ready to play and makes some adjustments to the original Half-Life 1, Opposing Force and Blue Shift maps to acommodate for the higher player numbers, meaning that proper cooperation with your crowbar banging fellows is essential to get past some tough situations. Everybody comes equipped with a medkit which allows it's operators to heal injuired team mates or even revive fallen allies to get them back up and running, you can even give ammo to people if they've ran out of shotgun shells.

So many hours of my weekends have been lost to the vast amount of things to do in Sven Co-op, Nights spent laughing with friends at the brutally unforgiving soldier AI who'll murder anybody who thinks they can withstand a squad of the HECU. Evenings of exploring cartoonish comedic maps where you need to stand on pannels that'll flip you supposidly into a wall where instead it'll just gib you, and of course you can never forget scaring that one friend who for some reason agreed to play horror maps late into the early hours of the morning.

Sven Co-op is the king of all Half-Life mods, new maps are released pretty much everyday on the SCmap database with already over 300 unique maps to download and play and with the improvements to the overall engine, you can hopefully expect some even better maps to soon follow. The potential longevity you can get from this is astounding. It's the ultimate party game for fans of the anthology and you can play it entirely free of charge.

reviewText:
Most fun with friends but there are always plenty of people playing online. It uses the Half-Life 1 game engine but it is completely free and you don't need to buy HL1; as a result the graphics are below-average but nostalgic (but it's free!).

If you join a server with enough players (at least 2 or 3) who know what they're doing, you don't have to know too much about what's happening but can still help out and learn as you go along.

Typical experience:
- Join server. Start on a Half-Life 1 level where everyone spawns with a rocket launcher, and the spawn point is on a building full of explosives.
- Try to walk down the corridor when suddenly another player accidentally" fires a rocket and destroys the whole building
date: which kills everyone on the server and forces a map restart.\n- Spend the next 10 minutes trying to get to the end of the corridor; within 20 seconds of spawning someone "accidentally" fires a rocket again or walks into a tripmine
recommended:
restarting the map. Every. Time.

reviewText:
This game is a great classic.  It was around before Steam was even a thing.  If you like Half-Life then you'll enjoy Sven-Coop.  The best part is you can play with other people.  You can play some of it singleplayer but I recommend joining a friend or playing on a server because some maps are very hard and near impossible playing solo.  The graphics, gameplay and maps haven't changed from the early days.  I've noticed some tweaks but nothing major.  If you remember the weapons, NPC's, monsters from Half-Life...they're all here!

Pros:
A great Half-Life classic
Classic FPS gameplay
Multiplayer
Lots of maps
Customizations

Cons:
Few crashes - Even though this old game works good on the new Windows OS I've found that when there's a lot of people in one server and a bunch of stuff is going on at once it sometimes crashes.
Can't clip other players - If someone stands in your way (like a doorway) you can't move through them.  This can give trolls an opportunity to screw up your fun.
Vote popups - When someone calls a vote, a window pops up and you can't do anything until it's dismissed, bad during enemy encounters.
Noobs - If you're a long-time veteran of this game the noobs and young gamers on here will give you a hard time.  I've learned to help them out after they've got mad and thow a fit.  I don't want to offend them with my years of experience.  This isn't Call of Duty.  Some maps take patients to get though.  The noobs just don't understand games like Sven-Coop.  I know this isn't a game issue, more of a player issue.  But this is the first time in recent years I've encountered noobs of this caliber.  There's still lots of good gamers though, so it's ok.

reviewText: Sven Co-op is one of the earliest multiplayer gaming memories I have. It's the first game I played where people in public servers communicated over voice. It's the first game I got a microphone for so that I could communicate too. It's the first game that I would ignore my parents at my bed time and stay up late to play.\n\nIt's a great mod, but for some reason I stopped bothering with it when HL2 came out and there were promises of all brand new mods. That was a mistake. Sven is still the experience it used to be, and it's even better now that it includes the HL campaign updated to minimize loading screens (level changes). This has enabled me to not only share the HL campaign with friends who have never experienced it, but to also play it with them! Really cool!

reviewText: Pretty much the cooperative multiplayer that Half-Life shipped without, kind of like Synergy for HL2. After 17 years it's now on Steam and prettier than ever. The devs even got permission to throw in the original HL campaign for free, and you don't need to own the original game to play.\n\nJust keep in mind that the enemies in every map are tougher than in the vanilla game so hordes of cooperating players don't effortlessly mow them down...and remember that its community centers around a game that's not only pretty old, but considered pretty 'hardcore' as well. Play with friends if you don't feel like dealing with gamer toxicity.

reviewText:
[PLEASE NOTE I WILL BE UPDATING THIS REVIEW OVERTIME]
(Please note I have played Sven Co-op when it was (still is) on ModDB)

Sven Co-Op is a revolutionary HL1 mod witch lets you play the campaign with friends or players with maps squeezed together so you can explore as well as advance to beat the Xen aliens and USMC's trying to silence the facility.

Some new features came in like Survivor Mode, where you have to work to keep your crew alive through the BMRF.

Maps that aren't HL1 Co-Op include (and not in order):
-Toonrun
-Crystal
-Mommamesa
-Black Mesa: Special Tactics Sector.
-Desert Circle.
-Fortified.
-Stadium 4. (mainly used as npc boxing or some s**t)
-Turret Fortress

I have also discovered you can add your custom models into a new folder called svencoop_addons so if you wanna add the classic old HL1 models, you can.  (I mean, if you wanna)

Hopefully to see in the future is the support for OP/BS maps so I can play with those that have these games.

reviewText: SEVENTEEN MORE YEARS

reviewText:
Back in the era of 56kbps internet connections, Half-Life (the original one) was a hit. Since then, it has always been a hit or, I should put it this way, a revolution of gaming. It has set the standard of gaming and shooters alike. However, there was one problem back then. Most computer games are designed for only one player, and multiplayer exists in terms of split-screen and turn taking. They require player 2 3 4 and other subsequent players to be there physcially. Online gaming exists only in the form of flash games on websites and yahoo! chess and stuffs. To be honest, online connection was never stable at that time, and you're pretty much done when your mom wished to make a call.

Then came cable and ADSL, which allows internet speed to go up to 512kbps or 1Mbps at that point, which is fast enough for most games, such as counter-strike. Good enough at that time.

Of course, most online shooters at that time (the pre-directx 8 era) are mainly team based and deathmatch games (team fortress classic and counter-strike are some examples), and little attention were paid to story-lines and co-operative plots when it comes to online multiplayer shooters. Most online multiplayer shooters are rounds and rounds of endless matches, of which some find them competitive while others feel that this type of gameplay can be rather mundane.

Then comes Sven Co-op. The most intrinsic idea of this mod (it's not a game, technically speaking) is to allow the possibility of having a multi-player co-op gameplay for the multi-award winning Half-Life shooter. It was this simple, yet in revolutionary for the valve franchise back than as multiplayer and story-based shooters had never mixed.

Soon enough, the community grew, and more players, custom maps and add-ons are added into the game. Sven coop has since been evolved and developed into a seperate branch of valve shooters - coop shooter - after gaining support and fame from half-life gamers. Till date, custom maps of all sorts, such as defense, maze and horde maps, can still be found lying around the corners of the internet.

That was more than a decade and a half ago. Today, we see Sven-Coop listed in our library again. Today, we celebrate this game which blended multiplayer and game plots together. Today, we can throw banana bombs in toon run, for free.

reviewText:
If some of you guys are wondering how to play this game with your friends  on your own server but have no idea how thenconsider trying this.This was the only way I find easy for me to play with friends.

-Host a game in Sven Coop by clicking Start a new game.Make sure to configure your server settings as you wish(Turn off LAN just to be safe).
-Create an account from this website https://www.evolvehq.com and download their app.
-Install it and run it.
-Once you have the app open go to your friends list window.
-On the top you should see a red button that says Friends.Add your friends' ign if they have already created an evolve account.
-Once all  your friends are added click the red Friends button again and click on create party.
-Invite them to your party.
-Make your friends copy your ip address in the party.
-They should go to the main menu on the game and press ` to open the console.
-Type in connect *insert ip address here*  without  the *
and voila.If there's an easier way than doing this then please tell me.

reviewText:
See my full review at https://decbot.wordpress.com/2016/01/24/sven-co-op-review-steam-release/

Sven Co-op. A game with 17 years of experience, is finally on Steam. And to tell you the absolute truth, I had never played it before it came on Steam.

I knew what it was, but I‚Äôd never played it.

Basically it‚Äôs Half-Life 1 Co-op

But here‚Äôs the thing. It‚Äôs amazing. But here‚Äôs the other thing. It‚Äôs not exactly what it sounds like. It sounds like Half-Life 1 optimized to play co-op of Half-Life 1. But that‚Äôs not what anyone does.

Most people play custom, adventurey, often crazy maps, that have been incredibly well coded and made, which is still fun, but don‚Äôt expect anyone to play through the entire of Half-Life with you.

Also, another thing, I‚Äôm incredibly surprised they (Valve) include HL, HL:OF, HL:BS, and even HL: Uplink, a game that until now hasn‚Äôt been fully, officially released by Valve.

Rest of the review here[decbot.wordpress.com]

I rate it:

87.5%
(Just so you know, Half-Life 1 would be around 95%)

It‚Äôs free. Now go play it.

reviewText:
I've played many hours of the mod version of Sven Co-op with my buds and without a doubt I can say that it has brought us countless hours of fun. The final standalone version comes with standalone support, meaning it does NOT require Half-Life or any of it's expansions to be played, however if you own and have the expansions installed you will be able to play those.

5.0 also comes with several new, fun maps. I highly suggest you download this and play with your friends, or just join a public game, although those can get pretty crowded and confusing sometimes.

I'm also very glad to see that Sven Co-op has been revived, since before the Steam release Sven was pretty much dead.

reviewText:
I've played the mod version since v4.6, and I will continue playing this.
Yes, I'll admit, I really only played on the now defunct Afraid of Monsters: Director's Cut co-op server.
However, I didn't ignore everything else about the mod. The amount of custom maps I've seen for this game is incredible, there's just  so  much of them. I really like the concept of this game, if it wasn't a mod at the time I started playing this back in 2012, I'd probably have over 250 hours logged into it.

Along with all of that are the admin tools (If you're an admin), which can be a hell of a lot of fun. I just go on a Hamachi server with a friend and just screw around with these admin tools. It goes to spawning and shooting fireworks into the sky, playing music/sounds server-wide, turning off the lights, making the flashlight bigger/smaller, making the flashlight a different colour, and messing around with Entmod.
That stuff was in the mod version, but I've tested all of that with v5.0. The only thing that doesn't work in this version is Metamod (as stated by the developers).

All in all, the community of this game is going strong, the gameplay aspect of this game is very fun (It's co-op Half-Life, what's not fun about that?), and I'll most likely play 250 more hours of this in the future.

reviewText:
My real personal experience with this masterpiece:
-Install game
-Open it after the fast install
-Spend 10 minutes in the main menu listening to the nice track
-Start searching for a nice playermodel
*30 minutes later*
-Stick with the first one in the list anyways
-Join a random server
-Everybody is screaming, running and shooting things
Map changes into They Hunger before I could realize what was going on
-Wait until the server tries and fails to sustain the high amount of players
*30 minutes later*
-I can finally shoot something, the lag is gone
Map changes
-Ok... I guess we're starting out fresh, let's do it!
-Try to figure out how to get yourself a good weapon like the others
*30 minutes later*
-Finally find a crossbow. Yes!
Map changes again. WHY NOT.
-Rage quit
-Close game
-Uninstall life

I'm really not kidding, this was my experience... more or less.
But, for the record, this is really a fun game.

~Find yourself a server with less players
~Teamwork
?????
~Profit

reviewText:
Almost immediately i was hooked on it. The co-opperation is a lot of fun, full game of 12 people, a great experience.
My story:
Got the game without having played HL1 ever before.
Went into a random match.
First thing i see are two mushrooms and nine human player models running around the thing which made the aliens come here. I joined them.
And then, we, as a small militia, beat the hell out of every alien (and scientist, with a crowbar). We were laughing and having a generally fun time.
After 2 hours in, i asked if we could make a group to stay in touch with players of the game. All of them joined it.
I made 11 new friends that day.
I would play it again, over and over. But the best part? It's absolutely free! What are you waiting for? Download it (and add me so we can play it!), and have one of the bset co-op experiences of your Steam experience, guarenteed!

9/10  Great gameplay,
Great co-op,
Many hours of fun (I will be playing more, trust me),
And a lot of laughs.

reviewText:
I'd be lying to you if I said I didn't find this game enjoyable, but it has some issues.

First off, why is every single map inexplicably difficult? Now, I don't mind a bit of challenge, but at times it can get ridiculous. Enemies have ungodly amounts of health, and take forever to go down even with other people helping you out. The puzzles can range from tedious to downright confusing, and most of the maps contain gratuitous amounts of broken English. I'm not ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• on foreigners, I'm just saying it takes from the immersion a little bit.

I'm glad this game finally got a proper Steam release, so hopefully the map-making community picks up a bit and maybe the problems I just mentioned will become a thing of the past, but even after playing for a bit, most of the problems are still there.

It's a good game to pass the time with some friends, but for a really good cooperative experience, this really wouldn't be my first choice.

reviewText:
My real personal experience with this masterpiece:
-Install game
-Open it after the fast install
-Spend 10 minutes in the main menu listening to the nice track
-Start searching for a nice playermodel
*30 minutes later*
-Stick with the first one in the list anyways
-Join a random server
-Everybody is screaming, running and shooting things
Map changes into They Hunger before I could realize what was going on
-Wait until the server tries and fails to sustain the high amount of players
*30 minutes later*
-I can finally shoot something, the lag is gone
Map changes
-Ok... I guess we're starting out fresh, let's do it!
-Try to figure out how to get yourself a good weapon like the others
*30 minutes later*
-Finally find a crossbow. Yes!
Map changes again. WHY NOT.
-Rage quit
-Close game
-Uninstall life

I'm really not kidding, this was my experience... more or less.
But, for the record, this is really a fun game.

~Find yourself a server with less players
~Teamwork
?????
~Profit

reviewText:
Half-Life has been out since 1997, the graphics were great for the time, the storyline, the puzzles, everything. It brings a good gameplay experience, in my opinion one of my favourite games ever, I grew up with it when I played it for the first time since I was around 3. Sven Co-op Is the greatest and the best mod for this game, not only can you play online with your friends and play through the whole game, you can download or make your own custom maps and experience them, best of all, It's FREE! No DLC, No Micro-transactions and no Expansion packs (You can still get Opposing-Force and Blue-Shift for their campaigns). Not only that but this mod adds a lot new content as in: weapons, maps, enemies, playermodels, and lots of stuff to mess around with. Ignore the negative reviews because it's just people whining about the graphics or that they can't solve a simple puzzle and have to look it up (because they have tiny brains and are inpatient). Load the game up and make a server. If making a dedicated or port forwarded server is too difficult or complicated for you, just download a program like LogMeInHamachi or Evolve and set up a private server where you can easily connect to eachother.

I rate it 10/10 - There are secret Chumtoads around the maps, also fun to find.


Oh and you can donate over 5 or 8$ to the creator of this mod for 2-3 donor features :)

reviewText: After over a decade of development, Sven Co-op launches on steam with a generous amount of well developed maps and fun gameplay. I only hope that we get regular updates that add more maps to keep the game alive. My favorite so far was Danger of Collaps" or sc_doc. It offered action as well as puzzle solving which is sadly absent from most others. You'll find a variety of maps/gamemodes similar to that of Left 4 Dead. Not really a problem but It's much more satisfying to get on a server and work as a team to solve puzzles
recommended: use your mind a little bit. Again I haven't played all the maps but the running theme is kill mindless zombies/aliens/soliders until you reach the next room. One downside is the lack of official servers. I know they're a modding group and don't focus on servers but the only "official ones" I found were the "Nightfire source" servers which are probably not related to Sven and I found them dreadfully laggy. I don't want to see this game one day have one or 2 servers up like some other source mods. I know the devs are VERY devoted but it's such a relief to be able to play this game with people who may have never downloaded the mod before.\n\nOverall: Really fun and free to play. Only improvement i could think of is some official servers of some kind."

reviewText:
Product received for free

Aside from the odd server which has unexperienced players in it, Sven Co-op is a thrilling, intense and highly cutomizable mod for the original Half Life game, all bundled together into a free to play standalone. With no freemium purchases or microtransactions, you get the whole package in this bundle.

Mods are built into Sven Co-op to allow Roleplays, Labyrinths, Quests and much, much more on multiple servers. With Sven Co-op having a proactive community and the ability to make a standard Half-Life Vanilla server yourself, one can not get bored. I would recommend inviting all of your friends who love the Half Life series over to Sven and playing on your own server with them, nothing as hectic as 'partially' co-ordinated strikes against zombies, whilst only having crowbars. The interesting bit behind Sven Co-op however is the customization, with you able to change the colour of your 'avatar', which ranges from the models Sven Co-op has, the female versions of Gordon, Gordon himself, Barney, alternative skins, a Jill Valentine 'Half Life' style skin, Robots, Marines [Including Shephard from Opposing Force] and even Ivan the Space Biker! [The original Gordon].
With Sven Co-op allowing you to download extras, such as the campaigns for Blue Shift and Opposing Force respectively, you will not feel a sense of repetition in the campaign and when you're all done, you can go back to the Mod-built servers.

Overall Sven Co-op I recommend for anybody who wants a pure free-to-play game, wants to reminisce the old days of gaming or has wanted Half Life [1] to be Co-op. There is something in Sven to please everyone, ignore the negatives that people say, it is as easy to leave a server or mute the players and proceed on. The positives are only found by actually searching, I was unlucky as I automatically connected to a Russian Mod/RP Server, where everyone was screaming Russian over the microphone. I simply disconnected and joined a Vanilla server manually, from there on, it was easy going.

On a rating of 1 to 10, I would give Sven Co-op a 9.5/10, as it is the best it can be, the only downsides are.. You guessed it! The lack of 'Instructions' when you start up the game and the small amount of 'bugs' that are present, but are generally NOT gamebraking: I do not play this on a 'Gaming Rig', I play this on my Laptop and this game runs very smoothly for a ¬£200 Laptop. With the developers quite pro-active themselves, the bugs are not around for quite long before they get patched.

Sven Co-op in my eyes, is one of the best mods on the Half Life series and does not require anything at all, not even the base game to play. I would recommend this to anyone who asks me about Sven Co-op.

reviewText: Really brings me back to my childhood, one of my favorite mods ever finally has a home on steam as a standalone product, and it's completely free! Essentially Half Life levels modded to have co-op functionality, as well as custom levels created by the development team and the community. Playing Half Life 1 with friends is pretty enjoyable, but I think it's the faster paced custom levels that really shine. Well known favorites like the cartoonish Toon World return, plus some really wacky ones like this one map having me play in an RTS-like mode, commanding other players. There are team based competitions, puzzle solving adventures, tricky platforming levels, and more generic massive warfare shoot 'em ups. It's so fun to see what map is loading next, I honestly almost never know what to expect. ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, this game is cool.\n\nWhy are there even negative recommendations? I'm sorry that this free game that's usually a nearly two decade old engine looks and plays somewhat ugly? The game is based off of Half Life 1, so there's no reason to think the game will look modern in any way, but the gameplay fun more than makes up for it. This game really takes me back, and I'm certain that you'd have a good time blasting vortigaunts with friends and strangers alike. Some of my most memorable, formative" gaming years were over 10 years ago just running with groups of strangers opening fire on giant enemies in tandem while playing earlier versions of this mod
date: and I'm so glad it's back.\n\nIf you've never played Sven Co-op
recommended: you're missing out on a world of wacky fun."

reviewText: Its good to see Sven Coop revived again.I remember back in 2003 when i first heard about this mod.Me and my brother played it like crazy. I mean as soon as we returned home from school we would turn on out PCs and have a blast playing together. Sometimes we even skipped school just to play.Enough of my personal life. Let me tell you about the game.\nSo this game is MEANT to be Coop. That means some maps CANNOT be completed without a friend (for example 2 buttons need to be pushed at the same time or someone boosts someone else to reach an area and open a door for him). Gameplay is SUPERB. It feels like half life. So the game mechanics are the same. What about multiplayer? So there are some new aspects. Many maps allow respawn if you die which is good. Some maps wont allow that though which means that if you die your friend will have to revive you.Speaking of friends, you have to rely heavly on him as well as him on you. Teamwork is essential. You should heal your friend and vice versa since many maps dont have many medical items. The maps differ from each other. Although most of them are objective based there a few which are survival based and most of maps differ from eachother with different desing and objectives. Now here is the bad part. Since the game is free to play and runs well even on PCs made after the 20s (which may be a good thing for some of yall) it means that many people who decide to ruin the game experience for the others are frequent. Lag is terrible on public servers,people dont communicate with eachother and dont teamwork at all and just troll". To get the most out of this masterpiece you MUST play with people you know like your friends
voteText: your dog etc. As long as yall communicate with eachother you will be able to team work with each other. And after you finish a hard puzzle you will feel a great satisfaction. I just started playing the steam version but since 2003 i must have put many hours into this game. One last thing before i conclude my review. This game supports many players in one server but i say less is better. I suggest 2-3 players because that way you can manage ammo better
helpfulPercent: communicate with eachother better and effectively and do puzzles faster. I played this game only with my brother up to this day and managed to finish almost every map. But that depends on you. If you want to play for fun and have a good laugh go ahead and invite as many friends as you like but if you play competitively and serious i suggest to keep a low number of players. The verdict is a solid 10/10
votesHelpful: a masterpiece. This mod was created in 1999 and still holds up to this day.If you didnt play it back in the day i suggest you do it now! This is a must have in your steam library and is guaranteed to give you countless hours of fun. I have a great respects for the team who created this mod. Great job guys!"

reviewText:
The basic information about this game:Name: Sven Co-op
Published and released by: Sven Co-op Team
Date of release: 19 January 1999

Gameplay:Sven Co-op is a very nice game for everyone who likes the Half-Life series. It is a standalone game, but with the maps of Half-Life. You can just do the maps of Half-Life with your friends! They have every map of it, but not only that, you can play it with gun mods, character mods, and much, much more! You will find it out when you play this great game! It will begin with the classic begin in the train, that is bringing you (and eventually a friend or more friends if you play with them) to the Black Mesa Facility in Mexico. You start without any weapon or something, you have just to go walk and explore the building and talk to professors, and they can told you where you have to go, or what you have to do. You can also do funny things like if you go to a place that looks like a kitchen you are able to break stuff like a magnetron, or you can start the alarm, and much, much more things like that. Let's continue: You are walking and talking, but you have to go to a place where you can find H.E.V suits and a professor that is saying to you that you have to grab a H.E.V Suit (a suit that you have for giving you more protection) And now the real work begins! You have to grab the old good crowbar and you have to escape the Black Mesa Facility‚Ä¶ The graphics of this game are low, but that is logic, because this game was made in the 90's. The sound and battle sound is very similar to a situation, every situation has it‚Äôs own sound, and the music is very logical with the game, so that is good. Also don't forget to bash the crates! :) Note: I could told a bit more about the game, but then I was maybe spoiling...

Conclusion:My conclusion about this game is that the game is well structured & organized, some weapons aren‚Äôt modded enough, sometimes the game can crash or freeze. Other than these small issues the game is also full of Easter eggs, secrets and other similar stuff. The replay value is decent, you will sometimes play a single level multiple times. I'll give this game a rating of 9,25 /10! Cuz this is literary one of my best games that I have, so that's why. Well, this was my review about this very awesome game! I hope you enjoyed reading this!

reviewText: I love the Half-Life series. A lot. It's my favorite FPS series of all-time, right after Doom. I think it's pretty awesome that Sven Co-Op is on Steam now. I mean damn, we've been waiting for it to happen for a while now. That being said, there is a couple of things I'd like to say about this game. Firstly, why did the developers feel the need to slow down the running speed and get rid of bunny hopping? That was a very important factor in Half-Life. That's like taking away text from RPG games. You just can't do that. Secondly, was this an excuse to make the game free? I know all games that are free are usually free for a reason (*cough* Nexon Zombies *cough*) and those reasons usually being mechanic changes or something that downgrades it. No fast running is a perfect example. It's also kind of like the Alienware Alpha. It's an affordable gaming PC, which is cool, but what Dell doesn't tell you is that is has a piece of crap hard drive that breaks down in a year. Now all that aside, I love that this is on Steam now, and it's a lot of fun to play with friends. I also really love the new textures and weapons. Therefore, I rate this mod 7.5/10, just because it's not what it originally was -- a co-op mod for Half-Life; nothing more, nothing less.

reviewText:
Sven Co-op. Now free! Thanks, Valve.

A 17 year old mod still holds up in 2016. That just proves how a game can define a genre.

Let's look at some very good pros:

+ You do not need Half-Life 1.
+ The entire Half-Life 1 campaign mounted.
+ Play with friends.
+ PVP and other modes.
+ Custom playermodels
+ Hundreds of custom maps! You always feel like you're playing a new map.
+ Constantly updated.
+ Highly detailed weapons instead of plain low-poly weapons HL1 had.
+ Fully supported third-person mode.
+ Bots are usually smart, reactive, and actually take cover.
There's very few cons:

- Mouse sensitivity is awful. Change it when you start up.
- No custom sprays
- Hearing people constantly spam MEDIC!" and "TAKE COVER" can be annoying.
- Enemies can sometimes be unreasonably hard.
Sven-Coop redefines how well the GoldSrc Engine was back in the late 90's
date: and now you can test it with no cost! It does not matter if you're new to the Half-Life series
hoursPlayed: Sven-Coop let's you relieve your nostalgic times or even introduces you to the series
voteText: while being able to do it with friends.\n"

reviewText:
I played this when Steam first came out. My god, that was so long ago. In combination with Steam's launch populartizing HL1, so was Sven Coop. And it was really fun to play.

And quite a bit has changed, considerably.

Pros:
It's Half Life One, They hunger and several other mod campaigns merged into one, all of wich can be completed in single player (if you're really good at the game, most maps are forgiving though)

The playermodel selection is vast. From the HECU to being Boba Fett, you have a really nice selection of models to choose from.

Player colors, albeit limited, do exist. However, no neutral colors exist so no black/gray/white which kills off a lot of cool color combos.

It's free with no microtransactions and it never will have any.

If you own Opposing Force and Blue Shift, you can use the files in the svencoop folder to mount them on. And it does it flawlessly.

New HD (I mean REALLY HD) models, the look is extremely improved in comparison from the originals in 1999 and in 2004. You can chose between Software and OpenGL renders.

Heavily Optimized. Even if you own a potato, it will probably run about 30FPS on the highest possible settings.

Up to 32 players to go on a total massive rampage through various maps.

Voteban/Votekick/Votemap/Votemute to deal with trolls, squeakers, the average internet warrior in general.

Developers that actually care. Previously, I had joke that in the past 12 years I played this, they never added the Baclava HECU as a playermodel. They did in the first update shortly after the game came out (whether or not it is coincidental is beyond me but thanks anyway Sven Devs!)

Less than 1 GB in size yet it packs a huge amount of content.

Cons:

Like most gold source games, there's an Alias system. Which means you can use spoof names and freely troll and cause probelms and no one will know who you actually are on steam.

People can colide with one another, which can cause problems in terms of blocking doorways or breaking passages (that's what votekills is for though)

The Color system doesn't factor in White/Gray/Black, so the you're stuck with Red,Orange,Yellow,Green,Blue, Indigo, Violet and whatever colors are inbetween these.

All in all, it's an excellent game, most of the cons on based on opinion anyway. It's a good game to gather friends, and have a good time all in all. And it's easily playable by anyone, even if you own a rusty toaster. So Go ahead and download this game, have a blast!

reviewText:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

reviewText:
Sven co-op Version 5 is here at long last.

This mod is one of the longest running Half-Life mods in existence and with good reason, it allows us to play through Half-Life/Goldsrc-themed maps with our friends and it's changed alot since version 1, from the colour of the HUD which changed about version 2-3 to the Steam intergration which came with Version 3 and at version 4 you could even revive players and friendly NPCs such as guards and HECU marines.

But Version 5 they have outdone themselves yet again, with the addition of the inventory system which some launch maps are already taking advantage of no doubt with more to come, a free and somewhat improved version of the the original Half-Life's campaign to play with your friends aswell as the ability to mount the Opposing Force and Blue Shift campaigns if you have the games which haven't been edited at the time of this review. Two other long awaited additions (to me at least) is the fact if you're playing a campaign split into multiple maps such as Toonrun or Half-Life and you survive the previous map your guns carry over and aswell as this regular enemies drop their weapons when you kill them if the map supports it, the only campagin that i know supports this at the time of review is the regular Half-Life campaign, no doubt more maps will be edited with this feature in the future.

Let's focus on the edited version of the Half-Life campaign and the new classic" and "survival" modes for now. Classic mode restores the weapon's atributes to what they were in the game
date: such as the shotgun having a duel shot instead of being fully automatic for it's alt fire and in survival mode you don't respawn
recommended: although there are respawn tokens that look like a floating lamba symbol that revive everyone that's dead although you can revive people not long after they die if they haven't been gibbed. The only campaign i know that supports this at the time of writing this review is the original Half-Life campaign and they've handled it very well
hoursPlayed: alot of the maps have been edited togeather so there are fewer maps overall and if there's a section which prevents people from going back or creates a barrier it teleports everyone to that stage such as the lift towards the beginning of the Half-Life campaign which you have headcrabs coming down at you and there's a grinder at the bottom of the shaft.\n\nIf you're a fan of the Half-Life universe
voteText: including the Portal games or just a general Valve fan i reccomend giving this mod a go especially as it's one of the best mods based on a Valve game out there (imo) and it's free aswell as standalone."

reviewText: Probably the best mod of all time, not only is it a huge part of my childhood since its initial release in 1999 but it also hours of fun 17 years after it's original release. voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
FINALLY!
I've been waiting so for this to come onto Steam, along with the 5.0 update!

Gameplay:
The gameplay is like any other Half-Life 1 based game, simple & clean. Kill them with your arsenal, all that jazz! Not much to say about it. The weapon variety is pretty fantastic, along with the models of the weapons. Pistols, shotgun, SMG, and your trusty Rocket Launcher! Can't forget the alien weapons though, like the Snarks or the Shock Roach. If you really like crowds of people supporting you to take down the big bosses or huge waves of enemies, I'm sure you'll enjoy the gameplay to Sven Co-Op then. However, if the map is too small & the player amount is godlike huge, then there will surely be too much bumping into other players!

Soundtrack:
Can't really say much on the soundtrack, as most of the songs are ripped from the Half-life 1 Soundtrack. But that's besides the point, the main theme song is pretty retro. Or was at-least, until the 5.0 update remixed it. Otherwise it's good if you love the any Half Life 1 track out there.

Graphics/Visuals:
Obviously the graphics aren't too great due to it being made with GoldSrc (also known as Goldsource). They reworked all the Half Life 1 weapons so it has a great re-work to it. However, there is one con to the Shotgun animation actually. Sometimes if you fire too fast, the shotgun pushes back too far & goes off to the right of the screen.

Story:
While it has it's no  real story to it - It has it's own campaign/maps if that supports my statement. It's loads of fun, pretty much have to find out why you're there, what's going on, then stopping the problem head on by taking it to their world!

Conclusion:
Take the game as you want, I suppose. I just absolutely love it so much! I've been playing it for the longest time, is all. Very good experiences with this game as well.

10/10. ‚ô•

reviewText: An all time great, built off of the game that put Valve on the map. Sven Co-op runs on the Half Life 1 engine, modified over the past 10+ (!) years. The maps all vary, from realistic scenarios and maps set in Persia, to wacky colorful hjinks in a cartoon land called Toonrun, but the goal is the same: 2 to 16 players (Varies per server, can certainly go higher than this) all come together as a co-operative team to wage war against AI of all shapes and sizes across countless maps made by fans of, and talented devs behind, Sven. It's free, it's amazing, and it oozes quality and endless entertainment from every kilobyte that the game is comprised of.\n\nIf you enjoy first person shooters, this is a mandatory download.

reviewText:
Sven co-op Version 5 is here at long last.

This mod is one of the longest running Half-Life mods in existence and with good reason, it allows us to play through Half-Life/Goldsrc-themed maps with our friends and it's changed alot since version 1, from the colour of the HUD which changed about version 2-3 to the Steam intergration which came with Version 3 and at version 4 you could even revive players and friendly NPCs such as guards and HECU marines.

But Version 5 they have outdone themselves yet again, with the addition of the inventory system which some launch maps are already taking advantage of no doubt with more to come, a free and somewhat improved version of the the original Half-Life's campaign to play with your friends aswell as the ability to mount the Opposing Force and Blue Shift campaigns if you have the games which haven't been edited at the time of this review. Two other long awaited additions (to me at least) is the fact if you're playing a campaign split into multiple maps such as Toonrun or Half-Life and you survive the previous map your guns carry over and aswell as this regular enemies drop their weapons when you kill them if the map supports it, the only campagin that i know supports this at the time of review is the regular Half-Life campaign, no doubt more maps will be edited with this feature in the future.

Let's focus on the edited version of the Half-Life campaign and the new classic" and "survival" modes for now. Classic mode restores the weapon's atributes to what they were in the game
date: such as the shotgun having a duel shot instead of being fully automatic for it's alt fire and in survival mode you don't respawn
recommended: although there are respawn tokens that look like a floating lamba symbol that revive everyone that's dead although you can revive people not long after they die if they haven't been gibbed. The only campaign i know that supports this at the time of writing this review is the original Half-Life campaign and they've handled it very well
hoursPlayed: alot of the maps have been edited togeather so there are fewer maps overall and if there's a section which prevents people from going back or creates a barrier it teleports everyone to that stage such as the lift towards the beginning of the Half-Life campaign which you have headcrabs coming down at you and there's a grinder at the bottom of the shaft.\n\nIf you're a fan of the Half-Life universe
voteText: including the Portal games or just a general Valve fan i reccomend giving this mod a go especially as it's one of the best mods based on a Valve game out there (imo) and it's free aswell as standalone."

reviewText:
Short version:Get this game right now. You do not need Half Life 1. Just get it RIGHT NOW. DO IT! JUST DO IT! DON'T LET YOU DREAMS BE DREAMS. JUST DO IT!

Well I'll describe this game as I played it first. Then list some key points. Yeah. That should work.

Anyway. I started the game off absolutely sure I would be useless. I immediately get in there and help out my team in unexpected ways. Everyone has a medkit to heal their teammates so you can immediately become useful.

When I first started the game I found two nice players who greeted me right off the bat. Then I started solving some puzzles. I was amazed at myself. My 6 or so teammates seemed baffled by them yet I figured it out myself. So thats when I realized nobody is truely 100% useless(Unless you try to be useless)

We ended up after beating a mission having a monster battle. The enemy team only had about 3-4 headcrabs. We had 3 bullsquids and a human grunt. Needless to say the enemy team got slaughtered. There was another funny mini game we played later on as well.

So what do I think as key points?

Pros
-Well done and seems pretty solid as a idea.
-You can change your player model and many other neat settings you would not expect with the c key.
-Pretty smooth. In every way.
-Nice community. I don't know if I went to the right place but honestly everyone seemed nice and helpful. What a great bunch of players!

The In Between (Both help and hurt the gameplay)
-Puzzles can be very easy or very difficult. This could make you laugh in some cases or rage in others. If you want a challenge this is good.
-Enemies can be hillariously easy to kill or impossible depending on what your playing. This can lead to some rather unbalanced scenarios. Fun if you like chaos.
-It can be very silly on some missions. You can FEEL the unofficial on a lot of them. Honestly I think it is pretty amazing in many cases. You get to experience some intresting fights and situations you never would otherwise.

Con
-If your a graphics freak you will be annoyed probably. I really don't see this as a big issue. The pros make up for this easily.

I really can't think of another con honestly. Most of them are in between and not completely a con. Honestly I think I should just call the inbetween section pros anyway.

Get this. It is worth it.

reviewText:
Where do I begin? I have not been here since the beginning or 3.0, 4.5 being my first version, so I may not have the right to say this. But let me just get to the point: I love this game. It is geniunely one of my all time favorite games, and I as a nerd played a bunch of games. I still think this game is great to today. I still play it alot. I have thousands of hours in the 4.x mod versions. And I think so far that 5.0 is great too. I even have my own dedicated server still up.

But, it saddens me to say that the developers or atleast a few of them have lost their mind.  I'm not gonna write a giant ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• rant about this because you came here to read a review about the game, not some stupid nerd whine about a problem you don't care about, but yes. Sniper has lost his damn mind.



Pros:
- Great and addictive coop gameplay that seemingly never gets old to play with friends.
- Over 936 maps as of this review to playthrough.
- Aton of great addons you can customize your server with it to your liking.
- Ton's of stuff you can edit to your liking, such as sounds and player models, weapon models and more.
- Very easy to get a public or private server up and running.
- Hundreds of servers up as of this review.

Cons:
- Developers are a bit crazy right now.
- While I personally don't have a problem with this, some might be turned off by the Goldsrc engine's limits and graphics.

reviewText:
Creo que esta es la mejor modificaci√≥n de Half-Life, no hay mucho mas que decir.
Lo co-operativo de este juego, lo estabamos esperando muchos, si bien me gust√≥ mas sven-co-op 4.8, esta tiene lo suyo y no se queda atras.
El modelaje de las armas para ser GoldSCr el motor grafico, esta bien hecho, se nota todo el esfuerzo que se le puso.
Las texturas, en cambio se nota que, si bien muchos mapas tienen texturas propias, y eso se aprecia muchisimo de mi parte, hay otras que usaron excesivamente halflife.wad, las texturas LAB, C1A2, C2A3,etc, quiza le baje el peso al sven, pero comparado con los 2gb que pesa, no es nada.
El mapping, ac√° si se pasaron, es en el desarrollo, lo mejor, todos los mapas estan bien trabajados, se nota el brushwork, detalle por detalle, y re-mapear el half life acomodando todo fue lo mejor.
Las entidades, muchas son del half life, pero las que no, estan bien hechas.
Los fps, si bien hay mapas como they hungers, los de half life, osprey y otros que no laguea, se nota que usaron HLVIS en fast en varios maps, y eso laguea, ademas la iluminacion parpadeante, eso es lindo a la vista, pero no pensaron en los que no tienen placa :(

Otra cosa a destacar es que cuando ya te jugas todos los mapas, es aburrido,  a no ser que te bajes otros c:

Es un juegazo, pero puede ser mejor.
9/10

reviewText:
How a free to play game should be.
Co-op gameplay with server operated by other gamers.
Building upon Half Life it now offers the best Co-op experience with the single player maps.
Customisation to the mapper allows very unique maps (With mappers able to swap out models and sounds for their own).

reviewText: Now before I start this review, let me get something out there. I hate almost every f2p game besides tf2. Now, I said almost because holy moly is this game fun. As I write this it is already the first day and I have 15 hours. The maps are great, the people are fun and it runs on goldsource so it shouldn't lag out unless you have a garbage laptop like me but even on my piece of trash, the only maps I had issues on were Crystal and stadium4. All in all, this game brings hours of fun and will probably be a game I will play a lot but you never know.

While this is great and all
date: there are a few killer flaws...\n\n- This is the GoldSRC engine. Meaning lag compensation isn't a thing. If your ping is in triple digits
recommended: don't even bother.\n- FastDL is still in its infancy
hoursPlayed: making it a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• to host custom maps.\n- Nobody in my region plays this game

reviewText:
Product received for free

This is not what it looks, yes it is a modified hl game, but you just can't play the original campaign in co-op.
1) You can't get the server in a working phase.
2) Instead of playing the original hl campaign with your friends you have to choose modified maps
3) There is no story anymore, you spawn in the map and kill everything (at least trying to do that)
4) Most of the maps here haven't got an ending
5) This is just stupid, you start to play, you advance 2-3 rooms and that's it, you can't continue the map.

I don't recommend this, better play the sp campaign instead of wasting time on unfinished modified maps

2.If you played the original Half-Life, you can see that you can kill your allies (Scientists, Security Guards) well, in this game you cant kill them... and thats bad because if for example: you cant find a weapon and your only alternative is to kill the Security guard, well in this game... you just have to adapt to your current weapons...

3.Also this game has more bugs than the original (For a strange reason i lost my pistol and my crowbar... i only had a healthkit)

My recommendations are: Play the original Half-Life game and uninstall this game for better experience.

reviewText:
This game is very enjoyable game when playing with friends, but sadly has MANY painful flaws that affect my experience and enjoyment, That keep me from having fun and booting the game up ever again. Here's my personal rate towards this game (6.5/10) and a couple pro's and con's i had experienced through my run.

PROS

- The game is flat out simple: Run in and shoot'em up
- quick server downloads
- Lots of weapon choices

CONS

- many times in a server map one person will take point and just ditch the team, leaving you and the story detatched with already dead npc's laying around (A.K.A nothing to kill and nothing to experience because everything will be done and taken care of by the time i ever catch up)
- There are a 1,000 ways to die for no reason
- Most NPC's have beafy stacked health so if you tryed solo or have 3 friends join you, It would take countless reruns to finally back track enough to kill them.

reviewText:
Oh my...

Well on the outside looking in, this game has a lot of potential, playing co-op Half-Life? Awesome!
But the people at Sven have done things (or haven't done things) that pretty much completely ruin the experience.

1. Spawn points
In the old version of sven, there would be a map change every 5 minutes.
Now though, they've added a much longer distance between the spawn points meaning if you die right near the end, you have to run through the entire level just so you can cover 1/12th of ground which isn't easy cause...

2. Mandatory Survival mode
Yes, they have decided to make Half-Life a competetive game. So if you are playing with your friend and you die, the whole game restarts. Though there is a temporary fix for turning off this feature" (type in console: as_command survival_enabled0) constantly typing it in every single level just chips off a little bit more from the actual core experience of playing Half-Life but with other people.

3. Elevators
I've noticed a bug that no one really talks about inwhich if you stay on the elevator to the end of it's moving animation without jumping
date:
you will be unable to move and the only "temporary fix" is to type "Kill" in the commands and respawn 50 miles back at the start of the level.

So with those 3 things combined I gotta say this game is pretty dog ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. I could spend hours making threads and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• dedicated to fixing this stuff but I would much rather just play the original Half-Life in my library.

gg"

reviewText:
Me and my friend were having fun with this game, but one blaringly bad issue kept cropping up which is game-breaking.

Elevators. No matter what, elevators will either snare you and prevent you from being able to move at all, and you'll be lucky to break free...or they'll randomly kill you and your crew.

Until the elevators are fixed, you're going to find it near impossible to continue without having to fully restart or typing the kill command into the console in the hopes someone will find a respawn token for you to come back into the game.
